_meta.source: NBA Trade History Research - Deep Analysis

tree.name: OG Anunoby
tree.tradeDescription: NYK acquires OG Anunoby for RJ Barrett + Immanuel Quickley + future 2nd
tree.note: Elite 3&D wing, championship experience. Major defensive upgrade for NYK.

assetsGivenUp.name: RJ Barrett
assetsGivenUp.tradeDescription: Drafted 3rd overall by NYK after tanking season
assetsGivenUp.note: Former Duke star, Canadian connection helped TOR. NYK's face of rebuild.

assetsGivenUp.name: 2019 #3 Overall Pick
assetsGivenUp.tradeDescription: NYK had worst record (17-65) but dropped to #3 in lottery
assetsGivenUp.note: NYK tanked hard in 2018-19, worst record but lottery dropped them to 3rd

assetsGivenUp.name: 2018-19 Tank Season
assetsGivenUp.tradeDescription: NYK deliberately built bad roster to maximize lottery odds
assetsGivenUp.note: 17-65 record, worst in NBA. Sold veterans, played young players

assetsGivenUp.name: Veteran Talent Trades
assetsGivenUp.tradeDescription: NYK traded Kristaps Porzingis + others to clear roster/cap
assetsGivenUp.note: Porzingis trade to DAL cleared path for tank + future cap space

assetsGivenUp.name: Immanuel Quickley
assetsGivenUp.tradeDescription: Drafted 25th overall by NYK, Kentucky product
assetsGivenUp.note: Emerging 6th man, explosive scorer off bench. Fan favorite.

assetsGivenUp.name: 2020 #25 Overall Pick
assetsGivenUp.tradeDescription: NYK's own first-round pick from playoff-bubble season
assetsGivenUp.note: NYK went 21-45 in 2019-20, bubble didn't help their record much

assetsGivenUp.name: 2024 Second-Round Pick (via DET)
assetsGivenUp.tradeDescription: Acquired from Detroit in multi-team facilitator trade
assetsGivenUp.note: DET's 2024 second-round pick, sent to TOR in OG Anunoby trade. Used by TOR at #31.

assetsGivenUp.name: Contract Facilitation
assetsGivenUp.tradeDescription: NYK used cap space/roster spots to help facilitate Detroit trade
assetsGivenUp.note: Monetized roster flexibility into future draft asset

assetsGivenUp.name: Salary Cap Management
assetsGivenUp.tradeDescription: NYK maintained cap space specifically for trade facilitation opportunities
